industry: Staffing and Recruiting, Aviation and Aerospace Component Manufacturing, and Defense and Space Manufacturing
description:
Are you a Human Resource Director with a background in Aerospace & Defense manufacturing? Are you looking for a progressive role that can lead to global HR leadership positions within a multi-billion-dollar company?
Our exclusive client, a multi-billion-dollar Aerospace & Defense manufacturing organisation, is seeking a HR Director to lead a talented HR team, driving both tactical execution and strategic initiatives to attract, develop, and retain top talent. As a strategic partner to the senior leadership team, your expertise will shape the future of the organisation, aligning people strategies with business goals to drive business performance.
**Responsibilities of the HR Director:**
  • **Strategic Business Partner:** Serve as a key business partner to senior leadership, influencing and developing people strategies that drive business success.
  • **Successful Leadership:** Perform the role of a successful HR leader to a large HR Management and Talent Acquisition team to lead the way in people-focused initiatives
  • **Talent Management:** Anticipate industry trends, leading efforts in recruiting, retention, and workforce productivity. Build a pipeline of future leaders through robust succession planning and talent development initiatives.
  • **Organizational Effectiveness:** Champion change management, performance management, and diversity & inclusion programs to foster a high-performing, inclusive culture.
  • **HR Excellence:** Leverage data analytics to inform decisions, track HR metrics, and provide actionable insights to senior management.
  • **Muti-site HR Leadership:** Mentor and guide the local HR teams, maximizing their potential and driving continuous improvement in HR practices.

**Requirements of the HR Director**
  • Bachelor’s degree with 10+ years of progressive HR experience in manufacturing, including 5+ years at management level (ideally within aerospace or defence).
  • A track record of success in strategic HR leadership, with a deep understanding of employment laws, workforce trends, and talent management in a complex environment.
  • Strength of character with exceptional influencing, communication, and analytical skills, with the ability to drive results in a fast-paced, matrixed organization.
  • A proven history of partnering with senior leadership in a complex, large organization to enable successful business operations through strong HR leadership

If you are a Human Resource Director looking for a role that can offer genuine career progression on a global scale, where you can make a significant impact upon the future direction of a growing, multi-billion-dollar organization, please apply today. Suitable candidates will be contacted within 24 hours!
